memberdef.name: WindowModule

simplesect.para: This should only be used internally or by advanced users. Misuse can cause undefined behavior

briefdescription.para: Should be called a by Entity when System.init() is called.

detaileddescription.para: Calls onInit()

Overriding this function is dangerous. Only do it if you know what you are doing. Instead, override onInit()
This will make this Entity dirty.
Entity::DIRTY
This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.
GL_INVALID_OPERATION
If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context
InitializationError
If the property Entity::INIT is true, meaning init() has already been called.

briefdescription.para: Should be called a by Entity when System.update() is called.

detaileddescription.para: Calls onUpdate().

Overriding this function is dangerous. Only do it if you know what you are doing. Instead, override onUpdate()
InitializationError
If the property Entity::INIT is false, meaning init() was not called.

briefdescription.para: Should be called a by Entity when System.destroy() is called.

detaileddescription.para: Calls onDestroy(). Sets Entity::INIT to be false

Overriding this function is dangerous. Only do it if you know what you are doing. Instead, override onDestroy()
This will make this Entity dirty.
Entity::DIRTY
This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.
GL_INVALID_OPERATION
If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context
InitializationError
If the property Entity::INIT is false, meaning init() was not called.

briefdescription.para: Override this function and return a UNIQUE name for this Module

detaileddescription.para: The name for your Module is used in comparison, so make sure it is as unique as possible.
It is akin to a hashcode.

briefdescription.para: Bit location representing whether an Entity is dead.

detaileddescription.para:
If true, any Entity holding it will remove it and call kill()
Entity::getProperty(unsigned int)

briefdescription.para: Property defining if an Entity can be updated.

detaileddescription.para:
If this is true, update() will be called by it's parent.
Entity::getProperty(unsigned int)

briefdescription.para: Property defining if an Entity can be rendered.

detaileddescription.para:
If this is true, render() will be called by it's parent.
Entity::getProperty(unsigned int)

briefdescription.para: Flag representing whether an Entity's init() function has been called.

detaileddescription.para: If destroy() or update() is called and this is false, an InitializationError is thrown.

If init() is called and this is true, an InitializationError is thrown.
Entity::getProperty(unsigned int)

briefdescription.para: Flag representing whether an Entity's X position should move when it's parent is resized.
Flag representing whether an Entity's X position should move when it's parent is resized.
Flag representing whether this Entity has been hovered over.

detaileddescription.para:
The RenderProtocol used to render the Entity must set this.
ssl::bindEntity(Entity*)

briefdescription.para: Flag representing whether this Entity is dirty and it's positions needs to be recalculated.

detaileddescription.para:
This will become true under the following conditions:
The Entity has been changed. Assume that any non-const function other than render() and update() will trigger this condition.
The window is resized, moved, or created
Other classes that inherit Entity can also set this to true via Entity::setProperty(Byte, bool)

When an Entity becomes dirty, it will propogate up the tree. It's parent will become dirty, it's parent will become dirty, etc. This will continue until it reaches the highest level Entity, which is usually the GraphicsContext. From there, it will decide what to do based on it's Entity::DIRTY flag.
Certain GraphicsContexts may only render when something is dirty, heavily increasing performance in applications with little moving objects.
Additionally, an Entity that is considered dirty will have it's buffer updated on the GPU side.

briefdescription.para: std::vector of this Entity\'s children.

detaileddescription.para:
Use of this variable directly is unrecommended. Use addChild() or removeChild() instead.
This should only be used internally or by advanced users. Misuse can cause undefined behavior
